title.narrative: Reinforcing Immigrant Workers' Collective Power: A Continuation of Worker Leadership in Labor Education and Organizing Campaigns

description.narrative:
Poultry Campaign Activities: 1. Continue the research protocols which include up to 30 interviews of the 500+ poultry workers which were already surveyed across the state. 2. Deliver the research data which is translated and transcribed to lead researcher for UC Berkeley to be aggregated and placed into report form. 3. Provide support to the graduate students undertaking the coding of all surveys and interviews. 4. Assist in the acquisition of an additional 20-30 interviews of employers or managers in the poultry industry. 5. Publish the research report and widely publicize the finding in the report on the poultry industry treatment of workers. 6. Use the report, and the media attention to gain access to the poultry corporate headquarters and present them a list of policy changes as identified by worker members. 7. Offer to collaborate with the poultry producers on resolutions to the unsafe and inhumane treatment of workers. 8. Work closely with government agencies to assure companies are complying with policy changes, to assure retaliation of workers does not take place, and to draft regulation to prevent future violations of worker rights and dignity. 9. Assist IWJ and other national organizations in the development of a strategy to address the problems of poultry workers across the country.
Wage Theft Campaign Activities: 1. Conduct research to acquire statistics on wage theft violations to develop wage theft bill. 2. Obtain sample writing from other states of similar bills. 3. Draft the language of the ordinance with the help of attorneys using conservative language. 4. Conduct community outreach to 200 workers and 12 organizations to build our base allies. 5. Create a strategic plan with community allies to garner bipartisan support. 6. Invite community organizations to attend wage theft seminars. 7. Ask allies to participate in a letter writing campaign in support of the wage theft initiative. 8. Hold presentations to religious figures and religious community on the wage theft ordinance to educate them about our work and to seek their support. 9. Once wage theft ordinance is completed we will identify a city council member to introduce it. 10. Invite Kim Bobo to speak at our annual Cesar Chavez banquet to raise public awareness.

Women Worker’s Campaign Activities: 1. Meet with women workers to identify potential worker leaders. 2. Invite the potential workers to go with the workers' center to give presentations and workshops to encourage involvement in the center and develop their skills. 3. Identify a group of women workers to meet and develop a support team for women in the workplace. 4. Invite workers to go to skill building training organized by IWJ or other qualified organizations. 5. Provide personal development opportunities to women worker committees to empower them to seek a better life.

to support four campaigns focused on the poultry industry, anti-wage theft, women's rights, and heath and safety, as well as reinforcing the internal capacity of the organization, increasing membership retention and promoting worker leadership and participation through personal development seminars
